data.title: Oliver Parker Obituary
data.meta_description: LUNENBURG -- Oliver E. Parker, 97, formerly of Pleasant Street, died Wednesday, Oct. 4, in the HealthAlliance Hospital/Leominster.He was born in Lunenburg o
data.text:
Oliver E. Parker OBITUARY

LUNENBURG — Oliver E. Parker, 97, formerly of Pleasant Street, died Wednesday, Oct. 4, in the HealthAlliance Hospital/Leominster.

He was born in Lunenburg on June 2, 1909, a son of the late Richard N. and Mary B. (Berg) Parker. He graduated from Lunenburg High School in 1927 and received his bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering from Northeastern University in 1934.

He co-founded Shepard & Parker, Inc., an electric motor repair shop in Fitchburg, in 1946, and ran the business until his retirement in 1974. Following his retirement he moved to Arizona and Florida before moving to Leominster in 1986. Following the death of his wife of 55 years, Dorothy M. (Parker) Parker in 1991, he moved back to Lunenburg.

He was an active member of the Faith United Parish in Fitchburg, where he sang in the choir. He was Past Master of the Aurora Lodge AF & AM in Fitchburg. He belonged to the Lunenburg Men’s Golf League for many years and played golf until he was 90 years old. He was active in ham radio many years ago and belonged to local ham clubs.

He leaves two daughters, Rosemary A. Parker and her husband, Mack, of Lunenburg, and Cynthia P. Fraser and her husband, Gordon, of Concord; five grandchildren, Heather L. Milakian and her husband, Karl, of Boxboro, James B. Parker and his wife, Robin, of Lunenburg, Jeffrey P. Fraser and his wife, Courtney, of Concord, Catherine M. Parker-Tietgens and her husband, Christian, of Richmond, N.H., and David M. Fraser of Concord; and seven great-grandchildren. He is predeceased by a brother, John R. Parker, and two sisters, Ruth Sanderson and Frances Martin.

PARKER — On Oct. 4, Oliver E. Parker, of Lunenburg. A memorial service will be held on Sunday, Oct. 29, at 2 p.m. in the Faith United Parish, 820 Main St., Fitchburg. Burial will be in the North Cemetery. There are no calling hours. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to the Faith United Parish, 820 Main St., Fitchburg, MA 01420 or to a charity of one’s choice. The Lunenburg Chapel of the Sawyer-Miller-Masciarelli Funeral Homes, 763 Massachusetts Ave. is directing the arrangements. www.masciarellifamilyfuneralhomes.net.
